data.title: ROBIN WILLIAMS DIDN'T WANT TO DO 'MRS DOUBTFIRE 2'
data.meta_description: A friend of Robin Williams has revealed the late actor didn't want to work on any more films, including the upcoming sequel to 'Mrs Doubtfire.'
data.text:
PICS: Robin's most memorable roles

The anonymous pal, who lived near Williams in the Bay Area of California, told the Daily Telegraph the star's movie roles "left him drained and particularly vulnerable to depressive episodes."

Why Robin Williams will always be my most unforgettable celebrity interview

There have already been various reports suggesting that the actor was recently taking roles specifically for the money rather than creative reasons.

But the friend re-iterated how important the paycheques were. "He wasn't poor, but the money wasn’t rolling in anymore and life is expensive when you have to pay off two ex-wives and have a family to support,” he said.

Robin Williams with Sarah Michelle Gellar in 'The Crazy Ones.' Credit: CBS

The actor himself told Parade magazine in 2013, "The idea of having a steady job [on The Crazy Ones] is appealing. I have two [other] choices: go on the road doing stand-up, or do small, independent movies working almost for scale [minimum union pay]. The movies are good, but a lot of times they don’t even have distribution. There are bills to pay. My life has downsized, in a good way. I'm selling the ranch up in Napa. I just can't afford it anymore.”

These 8 gifs of Robin Williams dancing will make you smile

The source revealed the pair used to go cycling regularly near their homes. He added that the reason he signed up to TV show 'The Crazy Ones,' which was cancelled this year after one season, was because they filmed in California, meaning the star wasn't away from his family for any length of time.

The friend also suggested that Williams' third wife Susan Schneider was getting increasingly worried about the actor's mental wellbeing.

"His wife was very worried by the end," he said, "but she knew what she was getting into with him. Their marriage was great, very strong. It was all about what was going on inside of him."

'Mrs. Doubtfire 2' has been in development for some time, with Williams meeting writer David Berenbaum to discuss the script. The future of the project is now in doubt.
